description: Take in a spectacular view of the waves from these 100-meter cliffs.

reviews.title: Great time at Bluffer's Park
text: Great layout and views. The trails were well laid out and the environment was very well preserved.
It was very peaceful and serene.

reviews.title: A relaxed day at the bluffs celebrating happiness
text: The bluff needs a whole day to unfold its resplendence little by little with each passing hour From sunny and bright to pink skies and warmly lit to dark and star lit skies .. one can see the whole planetery changes in one full day . It clear and sweet tasting water adds to the majestic show of art of mother nature .. people come and laze around or they come in groups to party on the lawns , bar- B - que and have a feast or even swim in the water … overall being close to nature and with your loved ones does wonders to your body and mind

reviews.title: Shame on Bluffers park
text: Bluffers park worst service and food. Beware of being fooled. Nice atmosphere overpriced, poor service, no class, not friendly made a reservation then could not accommodate us. Food was disappointing
Don’t go there

reviews.title: Not recommended
text: Place is garbage. The local police blocked off the street access from the main road (Kingston). We had to pay to park from one of the hotels, then walk about 1.5 miles to the beach. The restrooms at the beach were soooooo disgusting!!! The beach itself was meh. I would not recommend this place.

reviews.title: Fantastic
text: It’s a gorgeous place for hiking, swimming, or sunbathing. Also try Rouge River. Feels like being on vacation.

reviews.title: Nice park for a walk as well the views
text: There are several places when you can see the cliffs, but this it the more accesible place.
The park is very nice and well maintained.
Nice place for walk and relax

reviews.title: Impossible to Find!
text: The address on Trip Advisor takes you to the marina, not the trail. We wound up finding the beach after parking at the marina and got a nice view of the cliffs from the beach. However, after that, we drove around forever trying to find the trail and could not find it. We were following signs with arrows to the “waterfront trail” and just would end up back on the main road without finding any cliff trail. We also noticed that many of the trail signs contradicted one another and pointed in opposite directions. It was very disappointing overall because we drove an hour outside of Toronto specifically to walk this trail. Perhaps it is easier to find during peak season because people are around to point you in the right direction. Good luck finding it!

reviews.title: Pretty with filthy restroom.
text: Very clear water, you can see to the bottom. The bluffs are pretty.  Restroom was hideous.  I recommend changing your clothing elsewhere.  All toilets were stopped up and there was an inch of waste water on the floor from the overflowed toilets.  No place to set your clothes or bag while changing clothing.  The actual change rooms were locked and could not be used.

reviews.title: Great for me time or a romantic picnic
text: Beautiful place within a short distance from Scarborough. Get in touch with nature in the middle of your day. Great for me time or for a romantic picnic

reviews.title: Yayyyy
text: This is one of the amazing places that i have visited by now. The water at beach is crystal clear and there is a park along the beach where we can have a walk and eat along with our friends and family. I loved the place and enjoyed so much here.

reviews.title: nice beach to visit with children
text: very crowded if you go during a holiday in summer but suits for BBq and music outdoors with large groups

reviews.title: Love this place in good weather and temperature
text: Great place to go with friends and family just to relax! When the temperature is mild its quite crowded there but still worth it. Nice scenery, very green well just beautiful and very clean.

reviews.title: Breathtaking.
text: Breathtaking views. People do ignore that sign and hop off for better pictures at thier own risk from what Ive seen. I went in the summer. Its a womderul place to picnic on the surrounding areas after or before taking in the sites. Romantic opportunity or even just tranquil and peaceful for a solo opportunity. There are sprinklers and a tiny play area for kids too.

reviews.title: Gorgeous view
text: Excellent on a hot summer day. Nice to just walk around and appreciate the natural beauty. And completely free, of course.

reviews.title: Gorgeous and often unknown
text: When the park is not overrun with people bbqing with thier families, you can actually take a walk here and find some extremely beautiful views. You do not feel that you are in Toronto let alone Scarborough. What a gorgeous place to be in the summer evenings.

reviews.title: The most Scenic park in the City of Toronto
text: A huge park with the beach to the east where you can go in the water. A marina in the centre and a restaurant. There is also a takeout restaurant open in the summer. To the west is more park and a rocky beach and the very scenic Scarborough Bluffs. Now there is a bus running down there in the summer. We've been here many times since we live very close. Been to many of the other parks which are also nice places like High Park. But this is my favorite. Sometimes people come here just to park there car and take in the scenery. Or walk up to one of the many rocks and sit and look out to the lake and the scenery of the many sail boats and the bluffs.

reviews.title: A good place to get away within the city
text: This is a little gem in Scarborough.  I never knew it was there.  Excellent place to enjoy nature and the outdoors that is close to the lake.

reviews.title: Beautiful quick escape
text: I've been here multiple times during spring, summer, and fall. It is amazing each time!
The waters are so clear and blue and it sometimes feels like you're not in Toronto anymore. So if you're looking for a quick getaway and peace from the city, come here for a serene recharge.

reviews.title: A great place for fall views and easy parking!
text: Went with a couple friends during the fall season and the leaves were beautiful! We went around 2pm, not too many people and we got to take lots of beautiful scenic pictures!

reviews.title: Nice Change of Pace
text: It’s been several years since I was last here. Plenty of free parking but why are none of the public restrooms opened???
Nice stroll along the water’s edge. A great venue that’s free. The restaurant was closed. Best to bring a picnic lunch. Lots of tables with great views.

reviews.title: Let’s be honest, it would be nice if people were respectful and not disgusting slobs who leave their trash everywhere
text: If there wasn’t so many trashy people who litter everywhere and was maybe ran as a pay per visit kind of place then yes this would be an awesome area to spend the day. Spot is nice the people make it ugly.

reviews.title: Off the Beaten Path...a geographical rarity.
text: I grew up an east ender, and have known the bluffs all my life. They are exceptionally beautiful and well worth the travel to get there. At the end of the beaches and a bit beyond, they're frankly a bit of a slog by transit, but doable. By car, also slow, but far easier....and frankly...the drive down the road to lake level is worth the drive. Pretty spot with facilities and plenty of parking available. TONS of Canada geese means TONS of poop, so maybe flip fliops aren't the most practical of footwear if you intend to walk ; )   I suggest taking a picnic or snack, or have a bite at the resto in the marina with pleasant views over the boats there. Lots of cool liveaboard houseboats to gawk at with the sandy cliifs as a stunning backdrop....

reviews.title: The Cliffs of Toronto
text: A gem - a favorite of locals.  Quiet and peaceful, with sailboats during the summer. Good for family picnics too.

reviews.title: Beautiful Nature Spot
text: This off the beaten path part of Toronto is located in the east end as part of Scarborough and is definitely worth the trip. The Bluffs are gorgeous and are a great area to spend some time in nature. They're also a great photo opporuntiy and the parks attached to them sometimes hold events.

reviews.title: Lovely walks and interesting geology
text: This area is wonderful for short or long walks. For those with a special interest in geology the bluffs and the whole escarpment area may be of interest. Close to beach.

reviews.title: beautiful
text: this is a park east of Toronto. Good for walks and lake Ontario views. Busy and not many places to buy food or drinks.

reviews.title: It's like our own Mediterraneian coast!
text: I highly recommend a bike ride out to the Bluffs. I remember the first time a friend took me out here, I couldn't believe that I was riding through Ontario, or along a lake. The view and path near the bluffs are simply stunning. A great daytime trip for the summer, especially when it's not crowded.

reviews.title: I love this place but I hate that tourist leave their garbage
text: This is a gem of the city. But two things irk me:
1) people who go and leave all their picnic garbage behind and
2) people who walk along the top and put first responders at risk coming to their rescue.

reviews.title: Scenic
text: The entire area is absolutely beautiful. There is very large beach(lake beach) nice and sandy with restroom facilities and food facilities. Great area for family picnic, lots of nearby trails to walk. A short drive away the cliffs over an amazing view. See pics.

reviews.title: Breathtaking
text: Love it... we jumped in for a swim... very high cliffs ...be very careful there!
If you're brave enough to jump into the cold blue waters be careful , lake ontario has drop offs.
Be smart here

reviews.title: An outing for our flurry friend and us on a quiet Sat morning
text: Beautiful and quiet pebble beaches on a beautiful Sat morning.My dog and us both had very nice photos op.An oasis in Toronto free of traffic or people.Easily accessible from the street after a short walk downhill, with washroom facilities nearby in the Rosetta McCain gardens.

reviews.title: Good Beach
text: Good place to go out with your family and friends. Neat and clean beach with good attritions. You can cook food and make campfire.  Best place for an evening plan.

reviews.title: Cudia Park has the best view for Sunrises!
text: right on top of the bluffs there's a place called cudia park, breathtaking sunrise view overlooking the water and beach! went at 6 am and was not disappointed. 5 min walk from the parking lot to overlook point, got great pictures and colourful skies over the water. definitely recomend

reviews.title: Breathtaking views
text: It was confusing figuring out how to see the bluffs.  The easiest way is via Scarborough crescent park. The bluffs are beautiful and worth the Instagram pic.

reviews.title: Beautiful Bluffs but Stay Safe
text: The Bluffs is a beautiful spot to visit spot to visit  with great views and beaches, trash bins , benches and ice cream.     It has also become a spot of controversy due to many not respecting  basic safety  rules resulting in many rescues due to people falling off the edge or getting stuck while climbing.  Breaching fences, disregarding notices re: not climbing close to the edge  for selfies is causing  problems for all, including first responders.  Some areas are being fenced off due to this  causing anger and concern for wildlife  in the community.  The Cliffs can also collapse and have done at times .  Please  come to Scarborough but travel in a respectful and safe manner.  The Bluffs are now frequently patrolled and many fines are being issued for not obeying the safety notices. The weekends bring massive traffic problems and lack of parking and crowding. During the week it is less of an issue.

reviews.title: Great Place to Visit the Beach and the Cliffside
text: It was a fun trip to visit the bluffs with my family and friends. We have a good time exploring the beaches and the cliff that oversee the view.

reviews.title: Stunning and versatile space
text: We were staying at a property overlooking the bluffs and wanted to check our the beach we saw off to the side. We were not disappointed. We enjoyed a long walk along the beach taking in the bluffs with all the fall colours was so beautiful. There were long walking / biking paths, hiking paths, and it would be a fabulous place to kayak (although we didn’t bring our with us this time)! So beautiful. Water was clear and although too cold to swim now I would definitely swim there as it looked clean and clear.

reviews.title: Beautiful place
text: It was a really beautiful place to visit. We easily found a parking spot, but it was on a Monday morning, at the end of September, so not many tourists around.
However, I found there was a lot of trash lying around, which is awful, considering there were many empty trash cans.

reviews.title: Extraordinary however it needs special maintenance
text: It’s spectacular but the city needs to give the Scarborough Bluffs high quality attention and add a proper walking path and update it to the glory it deserves.

reviews.title: Perfect Escape
text: I've been to the Scarborough Bluffs beach many times during the summer and it has remained a favourite of mine. The beach and lake, in my experience, are always very clean. The beach is quite long and extremely spacious, even during peak times. The water is sandy for majority of the stretch; the rocks start towards the end where there are less people (the photos I've added are taken there).

This beach is a great place for families, couples, friends, and solo travellers! There is a section that has lifeguards which is ideal for children. It is also relatively shallow pretty far out, similar to Wasaga Beach. One thing to keep in mind however is the limited parking spaces, especially during weekends. Once, we had to park on the street and walk down to the beach (maybe 20 minutes).
I definitely recommend a visit to this breathtaking beach, the views are beautiful!
